HEA_composition.Zn_role: used as a sacrificial component to create lattice disorder through evaporation

mechanism: freezes a disordered FCC HEA structure

FESEM.morphology: nanoparticles uniformly dispersed over MWCNT surface

STEM_HAADF.dispersion: nanoparticles evenly decorated over MWCNT surface
STEM_HAADF.average_size_nm: 8.33 (from size distribution in Figure S9b, Supporting Information)

lattice_disorder_evidence.STEM_observation: highly disordered atomic lattice in PtIrNiCoFeZn nanoparticle
lattice_disorder_evidence.TDS: strong background with high intensity around transmitted spot attributed to thermal diffusion scattering (TDS), interpreted as lattice disorder/vacancies

XPS.valence_state: high-resolution spectra indicate nanoparticles are not oxidized (Figures S13–S14)

ICP_MS.composition_statement: all elements meet HEA atomic-percentage definition; Zn has the lowest content due to depletion during synthesis

electrochemical_performance.EIS: lowest charge-transfer resistance among all samples

theoretical_calculation.TDOS_effect: vacancies increase total DOS near Fermi level
theoretical_calculation.d_band_center: not explicitly reported in the paper
theoretical_calculation.reaction_pathway: Volmer–Tafel mechanism enhanced by vacancy engineering
